credentials: PHD 2015 Univ Of Maryland At Baltimore
name: MOUMITA KARMAKAR

ratings.comment: AVOID AT ALL COSTS. I had never taken a stats class before this one and professor Karmakar lectured as if we were already PhD Statisticians. Lectures were all over the place and hard to understand. The homework were extremely long and complex, graded on accuracy. Although the class has open notes exams, the averages were still in the 60s. AVOID!!!!

Rating this professor a second time just so my point is clear. DO NOT take this class unless you enjoy learning three courses worth of stats material in one semester through rushed/unhelpful lectures with a professor that doesn't have an ounce of care for her students. If you've never taken stats, this course is tough with her incompetency to teach

If pain were normally distributed, this class is the outlier. Moumita runs it like a p-value cult leader, rejecting reason at α = 1. Her lectures? Statistically insignificant. Exams? Randomly sampled from the void. She made me question both regression and free will. Avoid like Type I error. Every lecture and exam is a hypothesis test. Avoid her!

The only materials to study off of are the slides which she flips between them back and forth not in order. She does not teach well. She gives homework that is graded on accuracy so if you're doing homework GO TO THE STATS LEARNING CENTER! Even googling answers can be wrong. AVOID IF POSSIBLE!
Her, recording her lectures might be the only good part about Stat 371, no practice problems or extra prep for exams, same exact layout for each homework. Avoid this class for your own sake.

My confidence interval for this professor goes something like this: (every single day I was in excruciating pain, this professor had me praying to a god I didn't know existed) She may preach ‘Normal' distributions, but don't get me wrong, there is nothing normal about this class. This class is like a regression model with no predictors.

I made an account specifically to rate her. She shows no compassion towards her students and her tests are comprised of material that she goes over once and provides no practice problems for, while also each being 25% of the grade. I have never seen so many bad reviews for a teacher, If possible avoid her at all costs, and if you can't, Pray.
Talks so fast

Do not take her class if you can avoid it. VERY slow to answer on Piazza and is condescending when she does. Stopped giving extra practice problems after the 1st exam, and is inconsistent/unclear with what students should know. She's hard to understand, and even w/ stats and R background I was struggling to follow, as she overcomplicates things.

One of the worst professors I have had at this university. Any question you ask via piazza or email she responds to in a condescending way. She also stopped giving practice problems after the first exam so the only thing you can study with for exams are homework and lectures. Very disorganized and I highly discourage taking this class with her.
Avoid at all costs

Im making an account JUST to rate Moumita Karmakar. If you have to take a stats course and she is the only teacher available TAKE THE COURSE A DIFFERENT SEMESTER. She somehow makes stats harder than any chemistry or calculus class I've ever taken. I wish i could rate her lower than a 1.

It's honestly shocking that someone with so little compassion for students is allowed to teach here. Her lectures were demoralizing, her expectations unrealistic, and her attitude made the class feel like a punishment rather than a learning experience. I've never seen so many students feel so defeated in one semester.

If you aren't religious, pick a religion and start praying, because you are going to need the insight and might of a higher power to get through this class with her. She literally had me take my makeup exam on a chair. A chair as a table. Do not take this class with her because every single negative review is factual and true.
im gonna drop out cause of her

This is by far one of the worst classes I have taken and I can also confirm all of the negative reviews to be correct. She and the TA's in this class take weeks to answer PIAZZA questions, if they answer them at all. She does not provide extra practice problems outside of HW and lecture slides, I recommend taking this class with another professor.
genuinely curious how this woman has a job

she doesnt respond to piazza questions, and when you email her she gets mad at you. she doesnt provide any practice problems and also barely gives out partial credits on exams. it's currently 3 days until the final for the exam and she still has not completed the study guide. do not take this class with this professor if you can! please!
classes makes no sense

I could go on forever about how terrible this professor and her class is. She is condescending in emails/regrade requests, provides no extra practice, rushes/skips through lecture slides, study guides are not insightful, exams do not reflect problems practiced. She does not at all care about your success. Who in the world let her teach this course?

This professor was the worst professor I have ever had. Huge lack of review/study material. Her "study guides" are just a list of concepts we should know and her notes on the lecture slides. Claims that the few class slides and hw problems are enough to understand material despite there being an average of 65% on an open note exam

Please take stats elsewhere. Fails to explain material thoroughly and go through enough practice problems in class to understand the concepts. Stopped giving additional practice for the exams. All you have to rely on is lectures and even then we skip some of the practice. Worst class I've taken so far. Doesn't attempt to aid to all student success.

Reviews are 100% accurate. Lectures are incredibly hard to follow; she skips through slides, homework assignments have typos, questions on Piazza don't get answered for weeks, and no practice exams are given. Please avoid taking this professor if possible. This class was way harder than it needed to be.
Lectures are all over the place, many typos, doesn't really give out partial credit, homework takes hours to complete, dull lectures, teaches through examples but test questions are more conceptual

Genuinely feels like we were tricked into taking this class. It isn't an "introductory" course when the professor teaches it like we should all have a PhD in statistics already. Incredibly unorganized and unreasonably difficult to complete. Help was practically nonexistent. Dreaded coming to lecture. Made me cry several times.

This professor is incredibly bad at explaining stats! This is an intro class, but she explains things like it isn't. She doesn't answer ANY emails! I am great at math since I got a 5 on AP Calc in my senior year, and I am about to fail in this class because of her horrid teaching. DO NOT TAKE! This teacher must have gotten her degree from YouTube.
If you have no prior stats experience, do not take this class!! There's no textbook and she teaches things in a weird order and in a confusing manner.

This professor demands higher standards from her students than herself. You must be extremely precise and clear on the exams, while the answer key is very brief and contains inconsistencies / errors. Partial credits are NOT reasonably given. You will get a ZERO for "light" pencil marks or "unclear" writing, even if your answer was correct.

She moves through the lectures fast and also jumps around slides so it is very difficult to stay on track. She teaches concepts through one specific example which makes it difficult to know what is going on during the homework. Tests are conceptual but she teaches through calculations that are hard to understand and she only explains things once.

Course is so unorganized. Lectures are extremely boring, I swear I've never even seen her smile. The content itself is not that hard and I'm very good at math, but she makes it way more confusing than it needs to be.Tests are open note but no study guide/practice problems.Her english is perfectly fine tho ignore the other reviews that say otherwise

Difficult to understand, unorganized lectures, poor pacing. Syllabus is inaccurate as homeworks are graded late, and the syllabus claims there are T/F questions on the exam when there are not. Exams and homeworks are unfair as she has to give hints on homeworks and exam averages are in the 60s and 70s and you need a 92 for an A. Do not take.

I usually score AB-A's in all my classes, however, 371 with her was incredibly difficult. Exam 2 was incredibly difficult and felt like there were many things that we did not completely cover. She explains things fast and acts like we get it on the first try. It's hard to understand  her during lectures, and it is hard to stay engaged in her class.

Doesn't uphold her end of the syllabus: homework is graded weeks after promised by syllabus, piazza posts left unanswered for several days/even a week sometimes when she promises an answer in 48 hours on syllabus. But we are expected to uphold every aspect of the syllabus. Feel unsupported in the course. Doesn't give enough practice.

I found 371 unnecessarily hard due to Prof. Karmakar. Her lectures were often confusing and the information the was necessary to know wasn't clear. Also it took over a month for homework assignments to be graded even though in the syllabus it claimed it should only take a week. Also, the homework rubrics were unfair and unclear. Wouldn't recommend.

Tests are 80% of lecture, lectures are really heavy, if you ask she doesn't explain clearly, it's difficult to understand what she is saying, she is a really tough grader with tests, most people don't even finish the tests on time, she is not flexible, is mean and will not understand extemporaneos situations, if you can DO NOT TAKE HER!

Prof. Karmakar has been one of the least flexible and rudest professors I've ever had. Does not explain content and gets frustrated in class if content is not immediately understood. I have statistics experience and this class was near impossible.  Would avoid at all costs, she will tank your grade and does not care.

I took 571 with her, not 371. As a Grad student, this was the worst class I have ever taken. The class historically is structured terribly, but she simply isn't a good teacher. Lectures are confusing, she's unhelpful outside of class, and content is rarely explained. I had stats and r experience going in and I swear I lost knowledge. I would avoid.

Lectures are dense but comprehensive. She offers lots of office hours and hints for homework. There aren't many review materials, but tough homework prepares for the open note exams. Go to the SLC if you need help. There can be typos (which get dropped/regraded) and she's strict about not being talked over but that's not a big deal.

Unhelpful lectures. Professor is difficult to understand sometimes. No textbook, difficult to self study or get help. Skips around slides. Condescending, says class is simple but doesn't explain concepts well. HW/exams have typos. Homework takes ages sometimes, is graded harshly. Has to give answers to HW sometimes. Unhelpful TAs. Do not take.

The tags are complete satire, the opposite of what Moumita's class is. Pray you never take this class with her. Drop it if you are given her. lectures are a bunch of useless words and she doesn't explain what anything means, despite it being basic stats concepts

Prof. Karmakar's class is okay overall. The material isn't too difficult, but the lack of a textbook makes it very hard to study. Furthermore, her lectures are hard to understand and not very engaging. The homework is reasonable, and her late work policy is fair. The tests are pretty reasonable as well, but the lack of revision material is bad.

This professor was awful. The homeworks and exams had many typos and mistakes in them. The problems were often not clear. If someone had questioned her, she would completely disregard them. This was genuinely the worst professor I've ever had.

You can barely understand her, and she's rude. You ask a question, and she stares at you like you're the problem. Would not recommend it. Additionally, lectures are a nightmare to stay awake, and I never get tired during lectures. These KILL me! Run away while you can.

My time has come to have a nightmarish professor. She is rude. She's not great at English. Every exam, problem sheet, or practice set is riddled with typos or bad wording. I have an A currently, but I'm afraid for the future because she teaches like this. She grades unfairly and doesn't accept critique. Good luck to everyone who has her…

The lectures are messy and she skims over problems with hardly any explanation. Her English is not very good, and it is very difficult to understand her. She is VERY unhelpful on Piazza. She uses terms interchangeably and confuses students. Definitely take another professor if you can, it is not worth the time if you take the class with her.

doesn't know how to work technology, is unorganized, doesn't explain, skips around slides making it very hard to follow during lecture, kinda rude, CANT UNDERSTAND, doesn't answers on slides,  SO BORING, TAKE ANOTHER PROFESSOR IF U CAN

Her english isn't great so she's hard to understand. In lecture, she skims through problems and gives half answers. Lots of spelling mistakes in assignments and there uncovered material on the exams (midterm 2 was comical). She is very sweet but the aforementioned issues make this class harder than it should be so I'd get someone else if you can.

The professor has amazing, pertinent lectures and a deep understanding of statistics. Homeworks are fair as are quizzes. However, the tests did not always appear relevant or fair. She would answer questions in lectures, but seemed very derogatory. If you do not understand right away, it is easy to fall behind and she does not clarify well

She was not a good professor at all. Her tests are unnecessarily hard and she is not good at lecturing. There is barely a curve at the end of the semester so it is really hard to get a decent grade. Don't take her for this course if you don't have to.

Not a good lecturer. Exams were tough and graded inconsistently. My biggest pet peeve was the lack of communication and responses on piazza from her or any TAs. Felt useless to ask anything on there as it either wouldn't get answered or answered 3+ weeks after it was asked.

Her lecture notes are extremely difficult to read, follow, and derive any useful information from. She has a zero-excuses policy on any work submitted late. She does not respond to emails. She has the tendency to leave exams halfway through, leaving only the TAs to answer questions.
no responses on piazza, tough exams, not a good grader, no responses to emails, doesn't set up canvas properly
